bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
pjproject-2.4.5-6.fc24.x86_64 is horrible broken, all is starting fine but when you try to make a call asterisk crashs - downgrade to pjproject-2.4.5-4.fc24.x86_64.rpm and all is fine again _____________________________
Oct 02 10:42:02 INFO Upgraded: pjproject-2.4.5-6.fc24.x86_64
Oct 3 10:09:16 asterisk kernel: asterisk[1911]: segfault at 562d76373740 ip 00007f7ca0140e62 sp 00007f7cf2a50a40 error 4 in res_rtp_asterisk.so[7f7ca0136000+19000] Oct 3 10:09:16 asterisk systemd: asterisk.service: Main process exited, code=killed, status=11/SEGV Oct 3 10:09:16 asterisk systemd: asterisk.service: Unit entered failed state. Oct 3 10:09:16 asterisk systemd: asterisk.service: Failed with result 'signal'. Oct 3 10:09:17 asterisk systemd: asterisk.service: Service hold-off time over, scheduling restart.
rpm -Uvh --force pjproject-2.4.5-4.fc24.x86_64.rpm _____________________________
[root@asterisk:~]$ rpm -qa | grep asterisk asterisk-voicemail-plain-13.7.2-3.fc24.x86_64 asterisk-voicemail-13.7.2-3.fc24.x86_64 asterisk-iax2-13.7.2-3.fc24.x86_64 asterisk-sip-13.7.2-3.fc24.x86_64 asterisk-13.7.2-3.fc24.x86_64
That patch was rushed. I'll revert now. Please test upcoming 2.4.5-7 on bodhi today.

pjproject-2.4.5-7.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-f780687d5f

the same crap - no idea which other packages are using this but "Libraries for building embedded/non-embedded VoIP applications" makes asterisk sound like one of the main consumers - what about test it somehow before submit as fedora package at all?
[root@asterisk:/downloads]$ rpm -q pjproject pjproject-2.4.5-7.fc24.x86_64
Oct 3 17:33:39 asterisk systemd: Stopping asterisk... Oct 3 17:33:39 asterisk systemd: Stopped asterisk. Oct 3 17:33:39 asterisk systemd: Started asterisk. Oct 3 17:33:58 asterisk kernel: traps: asterisk[20935] general protection ip:7fdfeac98e62 sp:7fdfdf846770 error:0 in res_rtp_asterisk.so[7fdfeac8e000+19000] Oct 3 17:33:58 asterisk systemd: Started Process Core Dump (PID 20973/UID 0). Oct 3 17:33:58 asterisk systemd-coredump: Failed to send coredump datagram: Message too long Oct 3 17:33:58 asterisk systemd-coredump: Coredump file descriptor missing. Oct 3 17:33:58 asterisk systemd: asterisk.service: Main process exited, code=killed, status=11/SEGV Oct 3 17:33:58 asterisk systemd: asterisk.service: Unit entered failed state. Oct 3 17:33:58 asterisk systemd: asterisk.service: Failed with result 'signal'. Oct 3 17:33:59 asterisk systemd: asterisk.service: Service hold-off time over, scheduling restart. Oct 3 17:33:59 asterisk systemd: Stopped asterisk. Oct 3 17:33:59 asterisk systemd: Started asterisk.

Really sorry for cluttering the stable branches. This was sort of abandoned mid-testing and then rushed. Now I have no time at all for this project. Everything is now exactly as in 2.4.5-5 with the latest builds.
at least pjproject-2.4.5-8.fc24.x86_64 don't crash asterisk anymore in the moment a call arrives
